paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variant S631A, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: 1 female (6 years old), 1 male (father), 1 female (sister), 1 male (brother)
patients.phenotype: Short QT Syndrome (SQTS), abbreviated QTc intervals

individual_records.phenotype_details: experienced syncope and fitted with an implantable defibrillator (ICD)
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The index patient was asymptomatic until she experienced syncope a decade later and was fitted with an implantable defibrillator (ICD).
She, her father and sister were all reported to have abbreviated QTc intervals (of 340 msec or less, with the index patient <320 msec).
She, her father and sister were all reported to have abbreviated QTc intervals (of 340 msec or less, with the index patient <320 msec).
while an asymptomatic brother did not.

functional_data.summary: The S631A mutation leads to augmented I_hERG and affects repolarization dynamics.

variants.segregation_data: The S631A mutation segregated with disease in the family, as 3 out of 4 carriers were affected.
variants.additional_notes: The S631A mutation was found in a family with a history of sudden death.
key_quotes: The index patient was asymptomatic until she experienced syncope a decade later and was fitted with an implantable defibrillator (ICD).
She, her father and sister were all reported to have abbreviated QTc intervals (of 340 msec or less, with the index patient <320 msec).
while an asymptomatic brother did not.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant S631A was successfully extracted.
